intro: Arachnorchis strigosa, commonly known as the hairy spider orchid, is an Australian native plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its unique, spider-like appearance, with slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as rainforests and understoreys. Its leaves are strap-shaped and often covered in fine, hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Arachnorchis strigosa is a rare and protected species, often found in specific regions of eastern Australia.
